website_summaries.verdict: Comfort is the primary advantage that the Merrell Chameleon 7 offers to outdoor lovers everywhere. This trail shoe also receives good marks for its lightness and non-existent break-in period.Although these qualities arewell-received, the footgear’s lack of grip on wet surfaces raises a few red flags. Overall, this model from Merrell can bring satisfaction, granted there won’t be any slippery ground conditions on the trail.
pros: Droves of outdoor enthusiasts like the Merrell Chameleon 7 for being remarkably comfortable
According to numerous online consumers, this hiking shoe's break-in period is non-existent
The majority says that this piece of hiking gear runs true to its size
This Merrell product earns heaps of praises from the outdoor community for being a hiker with lightweight construction
A handful of purchasers appreciate its durability
A few adventurers praise the excellent arch support of this low-cut hiker
cons: Several adventurers lambast the Merrell Chameleon 7's outsole for not supplying sufficient grip on wet and slippery surfaces
A minority of users were bummed about the footgear’s laces and how they easily untangled during a hike
Some wearers claim that its toe box is quite narrow

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks , too narrow , Hadley designed lacing positions.
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased Merrell products with confidence of good quality . These cross trainers i have purchased are very substdandard. I purchased my usual size and too small, replacements sent one size up and i have used them on a walk. The soles\inserts squeak loudly with every step taken. Width fitting is far too tight and the top lace loop closest to your ankle is in the wrong position and is very uncomprtable and painfull. I simply can't believe the poor quality with Merrell logo on them.

product_meta.title: Merrell Chameleon 7 Walking Shoes
product_meta.description: Merrell Chameleon 7 Walking Shoes As adaptable as the reptile it's inspired by, this athletic-inspired hiker features protection, stability, and ultra-lightweight construction. Synthetic and Textile Upper The moisture wicking Chameleon 7 allows moisture that gathers on the surface of the shoe to be wicked away efficiently and effectively. Despite blocking moisture from passing to the inside of the shoe, air is able to penetrate through the material, for breathable comfort. Warm and muggy air that is building up within the shoe is easily able to escape and is then replaced by cooler air from outside of the shoe. This constant flow of air will keep you feeling fresh and ventilated over a long period of time, maximising comfort. The upper is made from a combination of synthetic and textile materials including a breathable mesh lining, this will mean that whilst it remains extremely lightweight, the material is also extremely tough and durable. This will provide both comfort and protection. Surrounding vulnerable areas of the feet, for example the toes and the heel, the material is thicker and will protect the areas from any bumps or knocks that you might receive. Securing the shoe to fit can be done in a combination of two ways with traditional laces and a hook in loop strap, allowing you to easily find a comfortable fit. After a day on the muddy ground, carrying the shoes around is easy with heel loops to prevent you from getting your hands dirty. A protective rubber toe cap enhances the durability of the Chameleon 7 keeping your forefoot safe from rocks and debris. Firm EVA Midsole The multi-functional midsole is designed to keep your feet healthy and feeling good on the trails. The EVA injected into the midsole will ensure that you won't feel any discomfort from heavy and sharp contacts from below.
